00079 void gerb_transf_free(gerbv_transf_t *transf)
00080 {
00081     g_free(transf);
00082     
00083 }/*gerbv_transf_t*/
00084 
00085 
00086 void gerb_transf_reset(gerbv_transf_t* transf)
00087 {
00088     memset(transf,0,sizeof(gerbv_transf_t));
00089     
00090     transf->r_mat[0][0] = transf->r_mat[1][1] = 1.0; /*off-diagonals 0 diagonals 1 */
00091     transf->r_mat[1][0] = transf->r_mat[0][1] = 0.0;
00092     transf->scale = 1.0;
00093     transf->offset[0] = transf->offset[1] = 0.0;
00094     
00095 } /*gerb_transf_reset*/
00096 
00097 
00098 gerbv_transf_t* gerb_transf_new(void)
00099 {
00100     gerbv_transf_t *transf;
00101     
00102     transf = g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_transf_t));
00103     gerb_transf_reset(transf);
00104     return transf;
00105     
00106 
00107 } /*gerb_transf_new*/

00109 
00111 
00115 void gerb_transf_rotate(gerbv_transf_t* transf, double angle)
00116 {
00117     double m[2][2]; 
00118     double s = sin(angle), c = cos(angle);
00119       
00120     memcpy(m, transf->r_mat, sizeof(m));    
00121     transf->r_mat[0][0] = c * m[0][0] - s * m[1][0];
00122     transf->r_mat[0][1] = c * m[0][1] - s * m[1][1];
00123     transf->r_mat[1][0] = s * m[0][0] + c * m[1][0];
00124     transf->r_mat[1][1] = s * m[0][1] + c * m[1][1];
00125 //    transf->offset[0] = transf->offset[1] = 0.0; CHECK ME
00126     
00127 } /*gerb_transf_rotate*/
00128 
00130 
00135 void gerb_transf_shift(gerbv_transf_t* transf, double shift_x, double shift_y)
00136 {
00137       
00138     transf->offset[0] += shift_x;
00139     transf->offset[1] += shift_y;
00140             
00141 } /*gerb_transf_shift*/
00142 
00143 void gerb_transf_apply(double x, double y, gerbv_transf_t* transf, double *out_x, double *out_y)
00144 {
00145 
00146 //    x += transf->offset[0];
00147 //    y += transf->offset[1];
00148     *out_x = (x * transf->r_mat[0][0] + y * transf->r_mat[0][1]) * transf->scale;
00149     *out_y = (x * transf->r_mat[1][0] + y * transf->r_mat[1][1]) * transf->scale;
00150     *out_x += transf->offset[0];
00151     *out_y += transf->offset[1];
00152     
00153     
00154 }/*gerb_transf_apply*/
00155 
00157 static double 
00158 pick_and_place_get_float_unit(char *str)
00159 {
00160     double x = 0.0;
00161     char unit[41];
00162 
00163     /* float, optional space, optional unit mm,cm,in,mil */
00164     sscanf(str, "%lf %40s", &x, unit);
00165     if(strstr(unit,"in")) {
00166        ;
00167     } else if(strstr(unit, "cm")) {
00168        x /= 2.54;
00169     } else { /* default to mils */
00170        x /= 1000;    
00171     }
00172 
00173     return x;
00174 } /* pick_and_place_get_float_unit*/
00175 
00176 
00179 int 
00180 pick_and_place_screen_for_delimiter(char *str, int n)
00181 {
00182     char *ptr;
00183     char delimiter[4] = "|,;:";
00184     int counter[4];
00185     int idx, idx_max = 0;
00186 
00187     memset(counter, 0, sizeof(counter));
00188     for(ptr = str; *ptr; ptr++) {
00189        switch(*ptr) {
00190        case '|':
00191            idx = 0;
00192            break;
00193        case ',':
00194            idx = 1;
00195            break;
00196        case ';':
00197            idx = 2;
00198            break;
00199        case ':':
00200            idx = 3;
00201            break;
00202        default:
00203            continue;
00204            break;
00205        }
00206        counter[idx]++;
00207        if(counter[idx] > counter[idx_max]) {
00208            idx_max = idx;
00209        }
00210     }
00211     
00212     if (counter[idx_max] > n) {
00213        return (unsigned char) delimiter[idx_max];
00214     } else {
00215        return -1;
00216     }
00217 } /* pnp_screen_for_delimiter */
00218 
00219 
00226 GArray *
00227 pick_and_place_parse_file(gerb_file_t *fd)
00228 {
00229     PnpPartData   pnpPartData;
00230     int           lineCounter = 0, parsedLines = 0;
00231     int           ret;
00232     char          *row[12];
00233     char          buf[MAXL+2], buf0[MAXL+2];
00234     double        tmp_x, tmp_y;
00235     gerbv_transf_t *tr_rot = gerb_transf_new();
00236     GArray    *pnpParseDataArray = g_array_new (FALSE, FALSE, sizeof(PnpPartData));
00237     gboolean foundValidDataRow = FALSE;
00238     
00239     /*
00240      * many locales redefine "." as "," and so on, so sscanf has problems when
00241      * reading Pick and Place files using %f format 
00242      */
00243     setlocale(LC_NUMERIC, "C" );
00244 
00245     while ( fgets(buf, MAXL, fd->fd) != NULL ) {
00246        int len = strlen(buf)-1;
00247        int i_length = 0, i_width = 0;
00248        
00249        lineCounter += 1; /*next line*/
00250        if(lineCounter < 2) {
00251            /* 
00252             * TODO in principle column names could be read and interpreted
00253             * but we skip the first line with names of columns for this time
00254             */
00255            continue;
00256        }
00257        if(len >= 0 && buf[len] == '\n') {
00258            buf[len--] = 0;
00259        }
00260        if(len >= 0 && buf[len] == '\r') {
00261            buf[len--] = 0;
00262        }
00263        if (len <= 11)  {  //lets check a minimum length of 11
00264            continue;
00265        }
00266 
00267        if ((len > 0) && (buf[0] == '%')) {
00268            continue;
00269        }
00270 
00271        /* Abort if we see a G54 */
00272        if ((len > 4) && (strncmp(buf,"G54 ", 4) == 0)) {
00273            g_array_free (pnpParseDataArray, TRUE);
00274            return NULL;  
00275        }
00276 
00277        /* abort if we see a G04 code */
00278        if ((len > 4) && (strncmp(buf,"G04 ", 4) == 0)) {
00279            g_array_free (pnpParseDataArray, TRUE);
00280            return NULL;  
00281        }
00282 
00283        /* this accepts file both with and without quotes */
00284 /*     if (!pnp_state) { /\* we are in first line *\/ */
00285 /*        if ((delimiter = pnp_screen_for_delimiter(buf, 8)) < 0) { */
00286 /*        continue; */
00287 /*        } */
00288 /*     } */
00289 
00290        ret = csv_row_parse(buf, MAXL,  buf0, MAXL, row, 11, ',',   CSV_QUOTES);
00291 
00292        if (ret > 0) {
00293            foundValidDataRow = TRUE;
00294        } else {
00295            continue;
00296        }
00297 /*     printf("direct:%s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s,  %s, ret %d\n", row[0], row[1], row[2],row[3], row[4], row[5], row[6], row[7], row[8], row[9], row[10], ret);        */
00298 /*     g_warning ("FFF %s %s\n",row[8],row[6]); */
00299 
00300        if (row[0] && row[8]) { // here could be some better check for the syntax
00301            snprintf (pnpPartData.designator, sizeof(pnpPartData.designator)-1, "%s", row[0]);
00302            snprintf (pnpPartData.footprint, sizeof(pnpPartData.footprint)-1, "%s", row[1]);
00303            snprintf (pnpPartData.layer, sizeof(pnpPartData.layer)-1, "%s", row[8]);
00304            if (row[10] != NULL) {
00305               if ( ! g_utf8_validate(row[10], -1, NULL)) {
00306                   gchar * str = g_convert(row[10], strlen(row[10]), "UTF-8", "ISO-8859-1",
00307                                        NULL, NULL, NULL);
00308                   // I have not decided yet whether it is better to use always
00309                   // "ISO-8859-1" or current locale.
00310                   // str = g_locale_to_utf8(row[10], -1, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00311                   snprintf (pnpPartData.comment, sizeof(pnpPartData.comment)-1, "%s", str);
00312                   g_free(str);
00313               } else {
00314                   snprintf (pnpPartData.comment, sizeof(pnpPartData.comment)-1, "%s", row[10]);
00315               }
00316            }
00317            /*
00318              gchar* g_convert(const gchar *str, gssize len, const gchar *to_codeset, const gchar *from_codeset, gsize *bytes_read, gsize *bytes_written, GError **error);
00319            */
00320            pnpPartData.mid_x = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[2]);
00321            pnpPartData.mid_y = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[3]);
00322            pnpPartData.ref_x = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[4]);
00323            pnpPartData.ref_y = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[5]);
00324            pnpPartData.pad_x = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[6]);
00325            pnpPartData.pad_y = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[7]);
00326            /* This line causes segfault if we accidently starts parsing 
00327             * a gerber file. It is crap crap crap */
00328            if (row[9])
00329               sscanf(row[9], "%lf", &pnpPartData.rotation); // no units, always deg
00330        }
00331        /* for now, default back to PCB program format
00332         * TODO: implement better checking for format
00333         */
00334        else if (row[0] && row[1] && row[2] && row[3] && row[4] && row[5] && row[6]) {
00335            snprintf (pnpPartData.designator, sizeof(pnpPartData.designator)-1, "%s", row[0]);
00336            snprintf (pnpPartData.footprint, sizeof(pnpPartData.footprint)-1, "%s", row[1]);              
00337            snprintf (pnpPartData.layer, sizeof(pnpPartData.layer)-1, "%s", row[6]); 
00338            pnpPartData.mid_x = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[3]);
00339            pnpPartData.mid_y = pick_and_place_get_float_unit(row[4]);
00340            pnpPartData.pad_x = pnpPartData.mid_x + 0.03;
00341            pnpPartData.pad_y = pnpPartData.mid_y + 0.03;
00342            sscanf(row[5], "%lf", &pnpPartData.rotation); // no units, always deg
00343            /* check for coordinate sanity, and abort if it fails
00344             * Note: this is mainly to catch comment lines that get parsed
00345             */
00346            if ((fabs(pnpPartData.mid_x) < 0.001)&&(fabs(pnpPartData.mid_y) < 0.001)) {
00347               continue;                   
00348            }
00349        } else {
00350            continue;
00351        }
00352 
00353 
00354        /* 
00355         * now, try and figure out the actual footprint shape to draw, or just
00356         * guess something reasonable
00357         */
00358        if(sscanf(pnpPartData.footprint, "%02d%02d", &i_length, &i_width) == 2) {
00359            // parse footprints like 0805 or 1206
00360            pnpPartData.length = 0.01 * i_length;
00361            pnpPartData.width = 0.01 * i_width;
00362            pnpPartData.shape = PART_SHAPE_RECTANGLE;
00363        } else { 
00364            gerb_transf_reset(tr_rot);
00365            gerb_transf_rotate(tr_rot, -pnpPartData.rotation * M_PI/180);/* rotate it back to get dimensions */
00366            gerb_transf_apply( pnpPartData.pad_x -  pnpPartData.mid_x, 
00367                             pnpPartData.pad_y - pnpPartData.mid_y, tr_rot, &tmp_x, &tmp_y);
00368            if ((fabs(tmp_y) > fabs(tmp_x/100)) && (fabs(tmp_x) > fabs(tmp_y/100))){
00369               pnpPartData.length = 2 * tmp_x;/* get dimensions*/
00370               pnpPartData.width = 2 * tmp_y;
00371               pnpPartData.shape = PART_SHAPE_STD;
00372            } else {
00373               pnpPartData.length = 0.015;
00374               pnpPartData.width = 0.015;
00375               pnpPartData.shape = PART_SHAPE_UNKNOWN;
00376            }
00377        }  
00378        g_array_append_val (pnpParseDataArray, pnpPartData);
00379        parsedLines += 1;
00380     }   
00381     gerb_transf_free(tr_rot);
00382     /* fd->ptr=0; */
00383     /* rewind(fd->fd); */
00384        
00385     /* so a sanity check and see if this is a valid pnp file */
00386     if ((((float) parsedLines / (float) lineCounter) < 0.3) ||
00387        (!foundValidDataRow)) {
00388        /* this doesn't look like a valid PNP file, so return error */
00389        g_array_free (pnpParseDataArray, TRUE);
00390        return NULL;
00391     }     
00392     return pnpParseDataArray;
00393 } /* pick_and_place_parse_file */
00394 
00395 
00396 /*     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00397  *     pick_and_place_check_file_type
00398  *     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00399  *     Description: Tries to parse the given file into a pick-and-place
00400  *            data set. If it fails to read any good rows, then returns
00401  *            FALSE, otherwise it returns TRUE.
00402  *     Notes: 
00403  *     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00404  */
00405 gboolean
00406 pick_and_place_check_file_type(gerb_file_t *fd, gboolean *returnFoundBinary)
00407 {
00408     char *buf;
00409     int len = 0;
00410     int i;
00411     char *letter;
00412     gboolean found_binary = FALSE;
00413     gboolean found_G54 = FALSE;
00414     gboolean found_M0 = FALSE;
00415     gboolean found_M2 = FALSE;
00416     gboolean found_G2 = FALSE;
00417     gboolean found_ADD = FALSE;
00418     gboolean found_comma = FALSE;
00419     gboolean found_R = FALSE;
00420     gboolean found_U = FALSE;
00421     gboolean found_C = FALSE;
00422     gboolean found_boardside = FALSE;
00423 
00424     buf = malloc(MAXL);
00425     if (buf == NULL)
00426        GERB_FATAL_ERROR("malloc buf failed while checking for pick-place file.\n");
00427 
00428     while (fgets(buf, MAXL, fd->fd) != NULL) {
00429        len = strlen(buf);
00430      
00431        /* First look through the file for indications of its type */
00432        
00433        /* check for non-binary file */
00434        for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00435            if (!isprint((int) buf[i]) && (buf[i] != '\r') && 
00436                 (buf[i] != '\n') && (buf[i] != '\t')) {
00437               found_binary = TRUE;
00438            }
00439        }
00440        
00441        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "G54")) {
00442            found_G54 = TRUE;
00443        }
00444        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "M00")) {
00445            found_M0 = TRUE;
00446        }
00447        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "M02")) {
00448            found_M2 = TRUE;
00449        }
00450        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "G02")) {
00451            found_G2 = TRUE;
00452        }
00453        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "ADD")) {
00454            found_ADD = TRUE;
00455        }
00456        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, ",")) {
00457            found_comma = TRUE;
00458        }
00459        /* Semicolon can be separator too */
00460        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, ";")) {
00461            found_comma = TRUE;
00462        }
00463        
00464        /* Look for refdes -- This is dumb, but what else can we do? */
00465        if ((letter = g_strstr_len(buf, len, "R")) != NULL) {
00466            if (isdigit((int) letter[1])) { /* grab char after R */
00467               found_R = TRUE;
00468            }
00469        }
00470        if ((letter = g_strstr_len(buf, len, "C")) != NULL) {
00471            if (isdigit((int) letter[1])) { /* grab char after C */
00472               found_C = TRUE;
00473            }
00474        }
00475        if ((letter = g_strstr_len(buf, len, "U")) != NULL) {
00476            if (isdigit((int) letter[1])) { /* grab char after U */
00477               found_U = TRUE;
00478            }
00479        }
00480        
00481        /* Look for board side indicator since this is required
00482         * by many vendors */
00483        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "top")) {
00484            found_boardside = TRUE;
00485        }
00486        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "Top")) {
00487            found_boardside = TRUE;
00488        }
00489        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "TOP")) {
00490            found_boardside = TRUE;
00491        }
00492        /* Also look for evidence of "Layer" in header.... */
00493        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "ayer")) {
00494            found_boardside = TRUE;
00495        }
00496        if (g_strstr_len(buf, len, "AYER")) {
00497            found_boardside = TRUE;
00498        }
00499        
00500     }
00501     rewind(fd->fd);
00502     free(buf);
00503 
00504     /* Now form logical expression determining if this is a pick-place file */
00505     *returnFoundBinary = found_binary;
00506     if (found_G54) 
00507        return FALSE;
00508     if (found_M0) 
00509        return FALSE;
00510     if (found_M2) 
00511        return FALSE;
00512     if (found_G2) 
00513        return FALSE;
00514     if (found_ADD) 
00515        return FALSE;
00516     if (found_comma && (found_R || found_C || found_U) && 
00517        found_boardside) 
00518        return TRUE;
00519     
00520     return FALSE;
00521     
00522 } /* pick_and_place_check_file_type */
00523 
00524 
00525 /*     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00526  *     pick_and_place_convert_pnp_data_to_image
00527  *     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00528  *     Description: Render a parsedPickAndPlaceData array into a gerb_image.
00529  *     Notes:
00530  *     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00531  */
00532 gerbv_image_t *
00533 pick_and_place_convert_pnp_data_to_image(GArray *parsedPickAndPlaceData, gint boardSide) 
00534 {
00535     gerbv_image_t *image = NULL;
00536     gerbv_net_t *curr_net = NULL;
00537     int i;
00538     gerbv_transf_t *tr_rot = gerb_transf_new();
00539     gerbv_drill_stats_t *stats;  /* Eventually replace with pick_place_stats */
00540     gboolean foundElement = FALSE;
00541     
00542     /* step through and make sure we have an element on the layer before
00543        we actually create a new image for it and fill it */
00544     for (i = 0; i < parsedPickAndPlaceData->len; i++) {
00545        PnpPartData partData = g_array_index(parsedPickAndPlaceData, PnpPartData, i);
00546        
00547        if ((boardSide == 0) && !((partData.layer[0]=='b') || (partData.layer[0]=='B')))
00548               continue;
00549        if ((boardSide == 1) && !((partData.layer[0]=='t') || (partData.layer[0]=='T')))
00550               continue;
00551               
00552        foundElement = TRUE;
00553     }
00554     if (!foundElement)
00555        return NULL;
00556 
00557     image = gerbv_create_image(image, "Pick and Place (X-Y) File");
00558     if (image == NULL) {
00559        GERB_FATAL_ERROR("malloc image failed\n");
00560     }
00561        
00562     image->format = (gerbv_format_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_format_t));
00563     if (image->format == NULL) {
00564        GERB_FATAL_ERROR("malloc format failed\n");
00565     }
00566     memset((void *)image->format, 0, sizeof(gerbv_format_t));
00567     
00568     image->layertype = GERBV_LAYERTYPE_PICKANDPLACE;
00569     stats = gerbv_drill_stats_new();
00570     if (stats == NULL)
00571         GERB_FATAL_ERROR("malloc pick_place_stats failed\n");
00572     image->drill_stats = stats;
00573 
00574 
00575     curr_net = image->netlist;
00576     curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00577     curr_net->state = image->states;      
00578     image->info->min_x = HUGE_VAL;
00579     image->info->min_y = HUGE_VAL;
00580     image->info->max_x = -HUGE_VAL;
00581     image->info->max_y = -HUGE_VAL;
00582 
00583     image->aperture[0] = (gerbv_aperture_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_aperture_t));
00584     memset((void *) image->aperture[0], 0, sizeof(gerbv_aperture_t));
00585     image->aperture[0]->type = GERBV_APTYPE_CIRCLE;
00586     image->aperture[0]->amacro = NULL;
00587     image->aperture[0]->parameter[0] = 0.02;
00588     image->aperture[0]->nuf_parameters = 1;
00589 
00590     for (i = 0; i < parsedPickAndPlaceData->len; i++) {
00591        PnpPartData partData = g_array_index(parsedPickAndPlaceData, PnpPartData, i);
00592        float radius;                         
00593        curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00594        curr_net = curr_net->next;
00595        assert(curr_net);
00596        memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00597        curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00598        curr_net->state = image->states;   
00599        partData.rotation *= M_PI/180; /* convert deg to rad */
00600        /* check if the entry is on the specified layer */
00601        if ((boardSide == 0) && !((partData.layer[0]=='b') || (partData.layer[0]=='B')))
00602               continue;
00603        if ((boardSide == 1) && !((partData.layer[0]=='t') || (partData.layer[0]=='T')))
00604               continue;     
00605        if ((partData.shape == PART_SHAPE_RECTANGLE) ||
00606            (partData.shape == PART_SHAPE_STD)) {
00607            // TODO: draw rectangle length x width taking into account rotation or pad x,y
00608            gerb_transf_reset(tr_rot);
00609            
00610            gerb_transf_shift(tr_rot, partData.mid_x, partData.mid_y);
00611            /* unrotate the part to make sure the label is in the same location */
00612            gerb_transf_rotate(tr_rot, -partData.rotation);
00613            /* this first net is just a label holder, so calculate the lower
00614               left location to line up above the element */
00615            gerb_transf_apply(-partData.length/2,partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00616                            &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00617            gerb_transf_apply(-partData.length/2,partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00618                            &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);
00619            /* re-rotate back to the correct orientation */
00620            gerb_transf_rotate(tr_rot, partData.rotation);
00621            
00622            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00623            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_OFF;
00624            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00625            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00626            curr_net->state = image->states;
00627            
00628            /* assign a label to this first draw primitive, in case we want
00629             * to render some text next to the mark
00630             */
00631            if (strlen (partData.designator) > 0) {
00632               curr_net->label = g_string_new (partData.designator);
00633            }
00634            
00635            /* rotate 180 to line up with PCB standard notation */
00636            gerb_transf_rotate(tr_rot, M_PI);
00637            
00638            curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00639            curr_net = curr_net->next;
00640            assert(curr_net);
00641            memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00642            gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/2, partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00643                            &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00644            gerb_transf_apply(-partData.length/2, partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00645                            &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);
00646            
00647            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00648            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00649            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00650            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00651            curr_net->state = image->states;
00652            
00653            
00654            curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00655            curr_net = curr_net->next;
00656            assert(curr_net);
00657            memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00658            
00659            gerb_transf_apply(-partData.length/2, partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00660                            &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00661            gerb_transf_apply(-partData.length/2, -partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00662                            &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);
00663            
00664            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00665            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00666            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00667            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00668            curr_net->state = image->states;
00669            
00670            curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00671            curr_net = curr_net->next;
00672            assert(curr_net);
00673            memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00674            
00675            gerb_transf_apply(-partData.length/2, -partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00676                            &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00677            gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/2, -partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00678                            &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);
00679            
00680            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00681            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00682            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00683            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00684            curr_net->state = image->states;
00685            
00686            curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00687            curr_net = curr_net->next;
00688            assert(curr_net);
00689            memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00690            
00691            gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/2, -partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00692                            &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00693            gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/2, partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00694                            &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);
00695            
00696            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00697            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00698            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00699            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00700            curr_net->state = image->states;
00701            
00702            curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00703            curr_net = curr_net->next;
00704            assert(curr_net);
00705            memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00706            
00707            if (partData.shape == PART_SHAPE_RECTANGLE) {
00708               gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/4, -partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00709                               &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00710               gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/4, partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00711                               &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);
00712            } else {
00713               gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/4, partData.width/2, tr_rot, 
00714                               &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00715               gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/4, partData.width/4, tr_rot, 
00716                               &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);
00717               
00718               curr_net->aperture = 0;
00719               curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00720               curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00721               curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00722               curr_net->state = image->states;
00723               
00724               curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00725               curr_net = curr_net->next;
00726               assert(curr_net);
00727               memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00728               gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/2, partData.width/4, tr_rot, 
00729                               &curr_net->start_x, &curr_net->start_y);
00730               gerb_transf_apply(partData.length/4, partData.width/4, tr_rot, 
00731                               &curr_net->stop_x, &curr_net->stop_y);     
00732            }
00733            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00734            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00735            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00736            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00737            curr_net->state = image->states;
00738            /* calculate a rough radius for the min/max screen calcs later */
00739            radius = max (partData.length/2, partData.width/2);
00740        } else {
00741            curr_net->start_x = partData.mid_x;
00742            curr_net->start_y = partData.mid_y;
00743            curr_net->stop_x = partData.pad_x;
00744            curr_net->stop_y = partData.pad_y;
00745            
00746            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00747            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00748            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_LINEARx1;
00749            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00750            curr_net->state = image->states;
00751            
00752            curr_net->next = (gerbv_net_t *)g_malloc(sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00753            curr_net = curr_net->next;
00754            assert(curr_net);
00755            memset((void *)curr_net, 0, sizeof(gerbv_net_t));
00756            
00757            curr_net->start_x = partData.mid_x;
00758            curr_net->start_y = partData.mid_y;
00759            curr_net->stop_x = partData.pad_x;
00760            curr_net->stop_y = partData.pad_y;
00761            
00762            curr_net->aperture = 0;
00763            curr_net->aperture_state = GERBV_APERTURE_STATE_ON;
00764            curr_net->interpolation = GERBV_INTERPOLATION_CW_CIRCULAR;
00765            curr_net->layer = image->layers;
00766            curr_net->state = image->states;
00767            
00768            curr_net->cirseg = g_new0 (gerbv_cirseg_t,1);
00769            curr_net->cirseg->angle1 = 0.0;
00770            curr_net->cirseg->angle2 = 360.0;
00771            curr_net->cirseg->cp_x = partData.mid_x;
00772            curr_net->cirseg->cp_y = partData.mid_y;
00773            radius = sqrt((partData.pad_x-partData.mid_x)*(partData.pad_x-partData.mid_x) +
00774                        (partData.pad_y-partData.mid_y)*(partData.pad_y-partData.mid_y));
00775            if (radius < 0.001)
00776               radius = 0.1;
00777            curr_net->cirseg->width = 2*radius; /* fabs(pad_x-mid_x) */
00778            curr_net->cirseg->height = 2*radius;
00779        }
00780 
00781        /* 
00782         * update min and max numbers so the screen zoom-to-fit 
00783         *function will work
00784         */
00785        image->info->min_x = min(image->info->min_x, (partData.mid_x - radius - 0.02));
00786        image->info->min_y = min(image->info->min_y, (partData.mid_y - radius - 0.02));
00787        image->info->max_x = max(image->info->max_x, (partData.mid_x + radius + 0.02));
00788        image->info->max_y = max(image->info->max_y, (partData.mid_y + radius + 0.02));
00789     }
00790     curr_net->next = NULL;
00791     
00792     gerb_transf_free(tr_rot);
00793     return image;
00794 } /* pick_and_place_parse_file_to_image */
00795 
00796 
00797 /*     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00798  *     pick_and_place_parse_file_to_image
00799  *     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00800  *     Description: Renders a pick and place file to a gerb_image.
00801  *     Notes: The file format should already be verified before calling
00802  *       this function, since it does very little sanity checking itself.
00803  *     ------------------------------------------------------------------
00804  */
00805 void
00806 pick_and_place_parse_file_to_images(gerb_file_t *fd, gerbv_image_t **topImage,
00807                      gerbv_image_t **bottomImage) 
00808 { 
00809     GArray *parsedPickAndPlaceData = pick_and_place_parse_file (fd);
00810 
00811     *bottomImage = pick_and_place_convert_pnp_data_to_image(parsedPickAndPlaceData, 0);
00812     *topImage = pick_and_place_convert_pnp_data_to_image(parsedPickAndPlaceData, 1);
00813 
00814     g_array_free (parsedPickAndPlaceData, TRUE);
00815 } /* pick_and_place_parse_file_to_image */
